name: Biological Integrity (IBI / community condition)
functionStatement:
Physical and chemical conditions enable spawning, juvenile growth, migration, and stress survival of target taxa.
Species interactions sustain biodiversity, restrain invasives, and build resilience to disturbance.
descriptionMarkdown:
Healthy numbers if historically supported, unless ephemeral dryness naturally excludes them.
IBI/multi-metric shows high integrity if historically expected, unless ephemeral dryness limits it.
Diverse macroinvertebrates (incl. EPT) if historically expected, unless ephemeral dryness limits.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Channel

Method: Field; Field screening and/or Desktop (biomonitoring databases); Desktop
howToMeasureMarkdown:
Conduct a brief visual or dipnet survey and record presence where expected.
Standard IBI score from sampling
Compile the most recent macroinvertebrate or fish IBI score or class from state or local databases for the reach or nearest station.

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Multiple observations where historically expected. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some presence but limited. / Rare or single individuals. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Absent where historically expected. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: BISON and/or iNaturalist as supporting context.
USGS BioData and/or EPA Water Quality Portal biological results (where available).
